title.narrative: School Rehabilitation and Support Programme of Baptist Convention Sierra Leone

description.narrative: This project aims at securing the Primary School attendance in three Northern sierraleonean towns of Makeni Lunsar and Gberray Junction. The region suffered from the 10 year Civil War which ended in 2002. The project strengthens civil society diminishes po verty and encourages people to return to their home district. As for the crosscutting objectives this project advances sexual equality and diminishes inequality by enabling children to go to school. Project strengthens existing school network in SL where a big amount of church-owned schools work side by side with state schools. Main beneficiaries are families and school children living in the areas in question. Schoolbuildings in poor condition after the civil war are renovated and furnished. New facilities are built where necessary because of increasing number of pupils. Families are encouraged to send girls to school by giving them school uniforms. Poorly paid teachers are provided with rice. Basic tools are bought for setting up vegetable gardens for sch ools.
